An appeal shall stay all proceedings in furtherance of the action appealed from unless the zoning administrator certifies to the board that by reason of facts stated in the certificate a stay would in his opinion cause imminent peril to life or property, in which case proceedings shall not be stayed otherwise than by a restraining order granted by the board or by a court of record, on application and on notice to the zoning administrator and for good cause shown. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-395. - Appeals procedure. 
(a)  Appeals shall be mailed to the board of zoning appeals c/o the secretary of the board and a copy of the appeal mailed to the secretary of the planning commission. A third copy should be mailed to the individual, official, department or agency concerned, if any. 
(b)  Appeals requiring an advertised public hearing shall be accompanied by a certified check for the fee which is on file in the town clerk's office, payable to the treasurer. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-396. - Public hearing. 
    The board shall fix a reasonable time for the hearing of an application or appeal, give public notice thereof as well as due notice to the parties in interest, and decide the same within 90 days. In exercising its powers, the board may reverse or affirm, wholly or partly, or may modify the order, requirement, decision or determination appealed from. The concurring vote of three members shall be necessary to reverse any order, requirement, decision or determination of an administrative officer or to decide in favor of the applicant on any matter upon which it is required to pass under this chapter or to effect any variance from this chapter. The board shall keep minutes of its proceedings and other official actions, which shall be filed in the office of the board and shall be public records. The chairman of the board, or in his absence, the acting chairman, may administer oaths and compel the attendance of witnesses. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-397. - Review of decisions of board. 
(a)  Any person aggrieved by any decision of the board of zoning appeals, or any taxpayer, or any officer, department, board or bureau of the county or municipality, may present to the circuit court of the county a petition specifying the grounds on which aggrieved within 30 days after the filing of the decision in the office of the board. 
(b)  Upon the presentation of such petition, the court shall allow a writ of certiorari to review the decision of the board of zoning appeals and shall prescribe therein the time within which a return thereto must be made and served upon the relator's attorney, which shall not be less than ten days and may be extended by the court. The allowance of the writ shall not stay proceedings upon the decision appealed from; but the court may, on application, on notice to the board and on due cause shown, grant a restraining order. 
(c)  The board shall not be required to return the original papers acted upon by it, but it shall be sufficient to return certified or sworn copies thereof or of such portions thereof as may be called for by such writ. The return shall concisely set forth such other facts as may be pertinent and material to show the grounds of the decision appealed from and shall be verified. 
(d)  If upon the hearing it shall appear to the court that testimony is necessary for the proper disposition of the matter, it may take evidence or appoint a commissioner to take such evidence as it may direct and report the same to the court with his findings of fact and conclusions of law, which shall constitute a part of the proceedings upon which the determination of the court shall be made. The court may reverse or affirm, wholly or partly, or may modify the decision brought up for review. 
(e)  Costs shall not be allowed against the board unless it shall appear to the court that it acted in bad faith or with malice in making the decision appealed from. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Secs. 94.1-398-94.1-419. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE XVIII. - ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT 

Sec. 94.1-420. - Zoning administrator. 
(a)  This chapter shall be administered and enforced by an officer to be known as the zoning administrator, who shall be appointed by the town manager, except in cases where the same person holds both the zoning administrator's and building official's titles, the appointment shall be made by the mayor. In performing these duties, the zoning administrator may receive assistance and cooperation from other town officials. 
(b)  The zoning administrator shall review all applications for building permits and certificates of occupancy as required herein with respect to the provisions of this chapter and shall approve or disapprove same based on compliance or noncompliance. 
(c)  The zoning administrator is hereby vested with all necessary authority on behalf of the town council to administer and enforce the provisions of this chapter including any conditions attached to an amendment to the zoning district map. Such authority shall include: (i) ordering, in writing, the remedy of any noncompliance with any provision of this chapter; (ii) bringing legal action to ensure compliance with provisions of this chapter, and (iii) requiring a guarantee, satisfactory to the town council, in an amount sufficient for and conditioned upon the construction of any physical improvements required by such conditions. 
(d)  The zoning administrator shall maintain records of all official actions taken with respect to the administration and enforcement of this chapter. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-421. - Building permits. 
    In addition to plans as may be required by the building code, all applications for building permits shall be accompanied by plans drawn to scale and in such number as required by the zoning administrator showing, with dimensions, lot lines, yards, buildings, the location of buildings on the lot, and such other information as may be necessary to provide for the enforcement of the provisions of this chapter. No building permit required by the town's building code shall be issued until the zoning administrator has certified that the construction proposed by such application and the use to be made of the building comply with all applicable provisions of this chapter. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-422. - Zoning permits. 
(a)  Buildings or structures shall be started, reconstructed, enlarged or altered only after a zoning permit has been obtained from the zoning administrator. 
(b)  The planning commission may request a review of the zoning permit approved by the zoning administrator in order to determine if the contemplated use is in accordance with the district in which the construction lies. 
(c)  Each application for a zoning permit shall be accompanied by three copies of a scale drawing. The drawing shall show the size and shape of the parcel of land on which the proposed building is to be constructed, the nature of the proposed use of the building or land, and the location of such building or use with respect to the property lines of the parcel of land and to the right-of-way of any street or highway adjoining the parcel of land. Any other information the zoning administrator may deem necessary for consideration of the application may be required. If the proposed building or use is in conformity with the provisions of this chapter, a permit shall be issued to the applicant by the administrator. One copy of the drawing shall be returned to the applicant with the permit. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-423. - Certificate of occupancy. 
    Land may be used or occupied and buildings structurally altered or erected may be used or changed in use only after a certificate of occupancy has been issued by the zoning administrator. Such a permit shall state that the building or the proposed use, or the use of the land, complies with the provisions of this chapter. A similar certificate shall be issued for the purpose of maintaining, renewing, changing or extending a nonconforming use. A certificate of occupancy either for the whole or a part of a building shall be applied for simultaneously with the application for a zoning permit. The permit shall be issued within ten days after the erection or structural alteration of such building or part has conformed with the provisions of this chapter. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-424. - Compliance with approved applications and plans. 
    Building permits and certificates of occupancy issued on the basis of applications and plans approved by the zoning administrator and building official authorize only the construction, arrangement and use set forth in such approved applications and plans, and any construction, arrangement or use not in compliance with that authorized shall be deemed a violation of this chapter. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-425. - Review of zoning admin- istrator's decision. 
    Any zoning applicant or any other person who is aggrieved by a decision of the zoning administrator made pursuant to provisions of this article may petition the board of zoning appeals for the review of the decision of the zoning administrator. All such petitions for review shall be filed with the zoning administrator and with the secretary of the board of zoning appeals within 30 days from the date of the decision for which review is sought, and such petitions shall specify the grounds upon which the petitioner is aggrieved. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-426. - Violations and penalties. 
    It shall be unlawful for any owner of any land, building or premises, or the agent thereof, or any lessee, tenant, architect, engineer, builder, contractor or other person to violate, take part in or assist in any violation of the provisions of this chapter or of any special exception or variance granted under the provisions of this chapter. Violation of the provisions of this chapter shall, upon conviction, be a misdemeanor punishable as provided in Code of Virginia, § 15.2-2286. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 94.1-427. - Fees. 
    Fees for applications for building permits and certificates of occupancy shall accompany such applications and shall be in such amounts as established by resolution of the town council. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Chapter 99.1 - DEFINITIONS FOR LAND USE ORDINANCES[1] 

Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Cross reference- Stormwater management, ch. 72; subdivisions, ch. 74.1; zoning, ch. 94.1. 

Sec. 99.1-1. - Applicability of chapter. 
    These definitions shall apply specifically to the zoning ordinance, subdivision regulations and stormwater management regulations but only after each ordinance has been amended to incorporate this chapter by reference in such regulations.* 
* The zoning ordinance contains such language in section 94-8. The draft revisions to the stormwater management regulations (section 71.1-3). The draft revisions to the land subdivision and development regulations (section 74.1-2). 
    For the purposes of certain land use and development regulations as are or may be established in this Code the words and terms set out below shall be interpreted as set forth in this chapter. Words and terms that are not defined herein shall be interpreted in accordance with their dictionary meaning or in accordance with their customary usage as is appropriate in the context. In addition, the rules of interpretation in section 99.1-2 shall be used concerning the specific words or terms enumerated. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 99.1-2. - General rules of interpretation. 
(a)  The present tense includes the future, the singular number includes the plural and the plural number includes the singular. 
(b)  The word "shall" is mandatory and the word "may" is permissive. 
(c)  The words "used" or "occupied" includes the words "intended, designed or arranged" to be used or occupied. 
(d)  The words "building" or "structure" include any part thereof, and the word "building" includes the word "structure. 
(e)  The terms "main" and "principal" are synonymous. 
(f)  The word "land" includes the word "water" and "marsh." 
(g)  The word "lot" includes "parcel." 
(h)  The word "approve" shall be considered to be followed by the words "or disapprove." 
(i)  Any reference to "this ordinance" or "this chapter" includes all ordinances amending or supplementing the same. 
(j)  All distances and areas refer to measurements in a horizontal plane unless another basis for the measurement is specifically indicated. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00) 
Sec. 99.1-3. - Definitions of specific words and terms. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in any land use regulations which incorporates the definitions of this chapter, shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning. 
    Accessory building or structure means a subordinate building or structure customarily incidental to and located upon the same lot occupied by the main or principal use or building. 
    Accessory use means a subordinate use customarily incidental to and located upon the same lot occupied by the main or principal use or building. 
    Acreage means a parcel of land, regardless of area, described by metes and bounds, which is not a numbered lot on any recorded subdivision plat. 
    Administrator. See "zoning administrator." 
    Adult day care center means any facility operated and licensed through the Commonwealth of Virginia for the purpose of providing care, protection, and guidance to a group of adults during a part of the day only, not to include sleeping facilities. 
    Agent (subdivision) means the representative of the town council who has been appointed to serve as the agent in approving subdivision plats under the land subdivision and development ordinance. 
    Agricultural operations. See "production agriculture." 
    Alley means a permanent service way providing a secondary means of access to abutting properties. 
    Alteration means any change in the total floor area, use, adaptability, or external appearance of an existing structure. 
    Alteration, structural, means any change in the supporting members of a structure, including foundations, bearing walls or partitions, columns, beams or girders, or any change in the supporting members of a building or structure. 
    Animal keeping, domestic, means keeping animals for the domestic use of a resident family such as pets, work animals, for equestrian purposes or for food sources. 
    Applicant means any person, firm, or governmental agency who executes appropriate forms or applications necessary to procure official approval of a project, secure a permit or request an action by any board, official or agency of the town. 
    Automobile graveyard means any lot or place exposed to the weather and upon which more than five motor vehicles of any kind, incapable of being operated, and which it would not be economically practical to make operative, are placed, located or found. 
    Basement means a story having half or more of its height below grade. A basement shall be counted as a story for the purpose of height regulations, if it is used for business purposes, or for dwelling purposes. 
    Bed and breakfast facility means a facility licensed by the Commonwealth of Virginia which is located within an owner-occupied residence and which offers accommodations for temporary use for sleeping with or without dining facilities. Accommodations shall not exceed four overnight guest rooms. 
    Billboard sign means a sign that directs attention to a business, commodity, service, or entertainment conducted, sold, or offered on the premises where the sign is located. A billboard sign shall be 300 square feet to 600 square feet in size. 
    Billiard parlor or pool room means a commercial recreational center operated as a business and offering three or more billiard or pool tables in any combination for use by the public for a fee. 
    Boardinghouse means a building where, for compensation, lodging and meals are provided for at least five and up to 14 persons. 
    Body piercing salon means any place in which a fee is charged for the act of penetrating the skin of a person to make a hole, mark, or scar, generally permanent in nature. This profession shall be regulated by the department of professional and occupational regulations as found in the Code of Virginia, 1950 as amended, in tit. 54.1, ch. 7 and also all sections of the Virginia Administrative Code pertaining to body piercing salons. 
    Brewery means a building or facility for manufacturing/producing craft beer. 
    Building means any structure having a roof supported by columns or walls, for the housing or enclosure of persons, animals or chattels. 
    Building, accessory, means a subordinate structure customarily incidental to and located upon the same lot occupied by the main structure. No such accessory structure shall be used for housekeeping purposes. 
    Building, principal, means a building in which is conducted the principal use of the lot on which it is located. 
    Building, height of, means the vertical distance measured from the level of the curb or the established curb grade opposite the middle of the front of the structure to the highest point of the roof if a flat roof; to the deck line of a mansard roof, or to the mean height level between the eaves and ridge of a gable, hip, or gambrel roof. For buildings set back from the street line, the height shall be measured from the average elevation of the ground surface along the front of the building. 
    Building, main, means the principal structure or one of the principal buildings on a lot, or the building or one of the principal buildings housing the principal use on the lot. 
    Building setback line. See "front yard." 
    Bulk storage means the storage of petroleum products in structures for subsequent resale to distributors or retail dealers or outlets. 
    Child care center means any facility operated for the purpose of providing care, protection and guidance to a group of ten or more children separated from their parents or guardian during a part of the day only except: 
(1)  A facility required to be licensed as a summer camp under the Code of Virginia, § 35.1-18); 
(2)  A public school unless the commission of welfare and institutions determines that such private school is operating a child care center outside the scope of regular classes; 
(3)  A school operated primarily for the educational instruction of children three to five years of age at which children three or four years of age do not attend in excess of four hours per day and children five years of age do not attend in excess of 61/2 hours per day; and 
(4)  A facility which provides child care on an hourly basis which is contracted for by a parent occasionally only. 
    Church (place of worship) means a building or structure, or group of buildings or structures, that by design and construction are primarily intended for conducting organized religious services and associated accessory uses. 
    Clubs means an organization catering exclusively to members and their guest, or premises and buildings for social, recreational, or athletic purposes which are not conducted primarily for gain; provided that any vending stand, merchandising, or commercial activities are conducted only as required generally for the membership of such club. 
    Clubhouse means a building, or portion thereof, used by a club. 
    Commission means the Planning Commission of the Town of South Hill, Virginia. 
    Conditional use. See "special exception." 
    Condominium means real property, and any incidents thereto or interest formed in compliance with the Virginia "Condominium Act" (Code of Virginia, § 55-79.39 et seq.) by recordation of the instruments pursuant to the provisions of that Code. No project shall be deemed a condominium within the meaning of this definition unless the undivided interests in the common elements are vested in the unit owners as defined in that Code. 
    Consignment store means a retail store that sells items on behalf of other parties, who receive a percentage of the selling price. 
    Construction/demolition/debris landfill means a land burial facility engineered, constructed and operated to contain and isolate construction waste, demolition waste, debris waste, or combinations of the above solid wastes. 
    Construction waste means solid waste which is produced or generated during construction, remodeling, or repair of pavements, houses, commercial buildings, and other structures. Construction wastes include, but are not limited to lumber, wire, sheetrock, broken brick, shingles, glass, pipes, concrete, paving materials, and metal and plastics if the metal or plastics are a part of the materials of construction or empty containers for such materials. Paints, coatings, solvents, asbestos, any liquid, compressed gases or semi-liquids and garbage are not construction waste. 
    Continuing care retirement community means a residential community that provides board, lodging and nursing services pursuant to an agreement effective for the life of the individual for a period in excess of one year including mutually terminable contracts and in consideration for the payment of an entrance fee (see Code of Virginia § 38.2-4900). 
    Cul-de-sac means a street with only one outlet and having an appropriate turnaround for a safe and convenient reverse traffic movement. 
    Debris waste means wastes resulting from land clearing operations. Debris waste include, but are not limited to stumps, wood, brush, leaves, soil, and road spoils. 
    Developer means the owner of property being subdivided or otherwise developed, whether or not represented by an agent. See "subdivider." 
    Development means a tract of land developed or to be developed as a single unit under single ownership or unified control which is to be used for any business, industrial or institutional purpose, or is to contain three or more residential dwelling units. 
    District means a zoning classification or zoning district into which the town is divided for purposes of land use regulation (referenced in Code of Virginia, § 15.2-2280). 
    Dump means a land site used primarily for the disposal by dumping, burial, burning, or other means and for whatever purposes, of garbage, sewage, trash, refuse, debris waste, junk, discarded machinery, vehicles or parts thereof, and other waste scrap, or discarded material of any kind. 
    Dump heap (trash pile) means any area of 100 square feet or more lying within 1,000 feet of a state highway, a residence, a dairy barn or food-handling establishment where trash, garbage or other waste or scrap material is dumped or deposited without being covered by a sanitary fill. 
    Dwelling, condominium. See "condominium." 
    Dwelling, multiple-family, means a structure arranged or designed to be occupied by two or more than two families, constructed in accordance with the Virginia Uniform Statewide Building Code. 
    Dwelling, quadruplex, means four attached single-family dwelling units in which each unit is located on a separate lot, has two open space exposures, no unit is placed over another unit, and each dwelling unit is separated from any other unit by two or more vertical common fire-resistant walls. 
    Dwelling, single-family, means any structure designed for use as residential purposes, arranged or designed to be occupied by one family, the structure having only one dwelling unit, constructed in accordance with the Virginia Uniform Statewide Building Code. Exceptions are hotels, boardinghouses, lodging houses, tourist cabins, apartments and automobile trailers. 
    Dwelling, townhouse, means a single-family dwelling unit that is constructed in a row of at least three such units in which each unit is located on a separate lot and has its own front and rear access to the outside, no unit is placed over another unit, each dwelling unit is separated from any other unit by one or more vertical common fire-resistant walls. 
    Dwelling, two-family, means a structure arranged or designed to be occupied by two families, the structure having only two dwelling units, constructed on a single lot in accordance with the Virginia Uniform Statewide Building Code. 
    Dwelling unit means one or more rooms in a dwelling designed for living or sleeping purposes, and having at least one kitchen; constructed in accordance with the Virginia Uniform Statewide Building Code. 
    Easement means a grant or reservation by the owner of land for the use of such land by others for a specific purpose or purposes. 
    Engineer means a professional engineer licensed by the Commonwealth of Virginia. 
    Family means one or more persons occupying a premises and living in a single dwelling unit, as distinguished from an unrelated group occupying a boardinghouse, lodging house, tourist home or hotel. 
    Family day care home means any private family home in which more than five children are received for care, protection and guidance during only a part of the 24-hour day, except children who are related by blood or marriage to the person who maintains the home. 
    Farming means an agricultural activity limited to the growing of plants or other crops including keeping of equipment for working fields. 
    Flea market means an occasional or periodic sales activity held within a building, structure or an open area screened by natural objects, planting, fences or other appropriate means so as not to be visible from a town street or otherwise removed from sight. "Visible" shall mean capable of being seen without visual aid by a person of normal visual acuity. This shall not include garage or yard sales. 
    Floor area ratio means the gross floor area of all buildings or structures on a lot divided by the total lot area. Floor area ratio is abbreviated FAR. 
    Fortune telling or palmistry means the practice of one who tells fortunes or gives advice for compensation using readings of skin patterns or other similar techniques. 
    Frontage means the minimum width of a lot measured from one side lot line to the other along a straight line on which no point shall be farther away from the street upon which the lot fronts than the building setback line (front yard) as defined in this chapter and required in the zoning ordinance. 
    Garage, private, means an accessory building designed or used for the storage of not more than three automobiles owned and used by the occupants of the building to which it is accessory. On a lot occupied by a multiple-unit dwelling, a private garage may be designed and used for the storage of automobiles for dwelling units as required by article XI of the zoning ordinance. 
    Garage, public, means a building or portion thereof, other than a private garage, designed or used for servicing, repairing, equipping, renting, selling or storing motor-driven vehicles. 
    Golf course means any golf course, publicly or privately owned, on which the game of golf is played, including accessory uses and buildings customary thereto, but excluding golf driving ranges as defined in this section. 
    Golf driving range means a limited area on which golf players do not walk, but onto which they drive golf balls from a central driving tee. 
    Guestroom means a room intended, arranged or designed to be occupied, or occupied, by one or more guests paying direct or indirect compensation therefor, but in which no provision is made for cooking. Dormitories are excluded. 
    Health club means clubs that are commercial in nature, such as fitness and athletics clubs, which include aerobics, tennis, racquetball, weight training facilities, etc. which are operated as a business for profit with membership open to the general public. 
    Health official means the health director or sanitarian having jurisdiction within the Town of South Hill. 
    Highway engineer means the resident engineer employed by the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT). 
    Home based business means an occupation carried on by the occupant of a dwelling as a secondary use in connection with which there in no outside display and where no one is employed other than members of the family residing on the premises. Home based businesses may include but are not limited to the following: beauty/barber shop, the selling of jewelry, food items, kitchen/cooking utensils, and cosmetics. The R1-15 zone shall be further restricted by the following: there shall be no commercial vehicles kept on the property, patron parking must be limited to the homeowners driveway and no signage will be allowed. 
    Homes for adults means any place, establishment or institution, public or private, including any day care center for adults, operated or maintained for the maintenance or care of four or more adults who are aged, infirm or disabled, except a facility or portion of a facility licensed by the state board of health and the Department of Mental Health, Mental Retardation and Substance Abuse, but including any portion of such facility not so licensed, and the home or residence of any individual who cares for or maintains only persons related to him by blood or marriage. Included in this definition are any two or more places, establishments or institutions owned or operated by a single entity and providing maintenance or care to a single entity and providing maintenance or care to a combined total of four or more aged, infirm or disabled adults. 
    Hospital means a building or group of buildings, having room facilities for one or more abiding patients, used for providing services for the inpatient medical or surgical care of sick or injured humans, and which may include related facilities such as laboratories, outpatient department, training facilities, central service facilities, and staff offices; providing, however, that such related facility must be incident and subordinate to the main use and must be an integral part of the hospital operation. See also "medical facility for emergency care" and "medical facility for long-term care". 
    Hotel or motel means a building or group of buildings on the same site containing lodging quarters for transient guests on a daily basis, and in which each lodging unit has a separate entrance either from outside or through a lobby. The terms "hotel" and "motel" included motor inns, motor lodges, tourist homes and similar establishments. 
    I-85 Gateway Interstate high-rise sign means a freestanding on-premises sign that is located on any parcel zoned commercial C-2 or industrial with any part of the parcel located within 1,500 feet of U.S. Interstate Highway 85 (I-85) right-of-way within the corporate limits of the Town of South Hill. These signs shall be allowed within the corporate limits of the Town of South Hill to include both the northbound and southbound lanes. I-85 Gateway Interstate high-rise signs shall have the following requirements: all parcels must be three acres or larger in size. There shall be no more than one high-rise sign structure per parcel. The high-rise sign structure shall have no more than four individual signs. The maximum sign height shall be 200 feet. If a high-rise sign is utilized, only one other freestanding ground sign will be allowed. Directional signs for internal traffic circulation shall be allowed. All signs shall comply with all state and federal regulations. 
    Junkyard means a fully-fenced and screened outdoor facility operated as a business for the purpose of depositing, keeping, storing and/or reselling of parts therefrom of any discarded materials no longer useable in their present form, including, but not limited to: dismantled or demolished motor vehicles that are inoperable and economically impractical to make operative; building materials; machinery; appliances and household items. The term "junkyard" includes "automobile graveyard" but specifically excludes sites such as land fills or trash dump sites that are designed to be used for the permanent disposal of refuse and other solid wastes. 
    Jurisdiction means the area or territory subject to the legislative control of the town council. 
    Kennel means, except as an adjunct to a veterinary hospital, a place to house, board, breed, handle, or otherwise keep or care for dogs or cats for sale in return for compensation. 
    Land surveyor means any certified land surveyor licensed by the Commonwealth of Virginia. 
    Livestock market means a commercial establishment wherein livestock is collected for sale and auctioned off. 
    Lot (for purposes of a subdivision) means a numbered and recorded portion of a subdivision intended for transfer of ownership or for establishment of a single building or use and their accessory building(s). 
    Lot (for purposes of zoning) means a parcel of land occupied or to be occupied by a main structure or group of main structures and accessory structures, together with such yards, open spaces, lot widths and lot areas as are required by the zoning ordinance, and having frontage upon a street, either shown on a plat of record or considered as a unit of property and described by metes and bounds. 
    Lot, corner, means a lot abutting on two or more streets at their intersection. Of the two sides of a corner lot, the front of the lot shall be deemed to be the shortest side fronting a street and the side of the lot shall be deemed to be the longest side fronting on a street. 
    Lot, depth of, means the average horizontal distance between the front and rear lot lines. 
    Lot, double-frontage, means an interior lot having frontage on two streets. 
    Lot, interior, means any lot other than a corner lot. 
    Lot of record means a lot that has been recorded in the clerk's office of the circuit court. 
    Lot, width of, means the average horizontal distance between side lot lines. 
    Manufacture and/or manufacturing means the processing and/or converting of raw, unfinished materials or products, or either of them, into articles or substances of different character, or for use for a different purpose. 
    Manufactured home means a structure subject to federal regulation, transportable in one or more sections which is eight body feet or more in width and 40 body feet or more in length in the traveling mode, or is 320 or more square feet when erected on site; is built on a permanent chassis; is designed to be used as a single-family dwelling, with or without a permanent foundation when connected to the required utilities; and includes the plumbing, heating, air conditioning and electrical systems contained in the structure.* 
* This language came from the state code at § 36-85.3. 
    Manufactured home park or subdivision means any area of five acres or more designed to accommodate manufactured homes exclusively. The minimum number of spaces completed and ready for occupancy before first occupancy is permitted shall be ten. 
    Medical facility for emergency care means a building or group of buildings wherein health services are dispensed by physicians and their skilled support staff to patients on an emergency or "as needed" basis but not including facilities for overnight accommodations. 
    Medical facility for long-term care means an institution or a distinct part of an institution that is licensed or approved to provide health care under medical supervision for twenty-four or more consecutive hours to two or more patients who are not related to the governing authority or its members by marriage, blood or adoption. This definition includes nursing homes, home for the elderly or a governmental medical institution. 
    Medical office means the office of a licensed physician, surgeon, dentist, or other licensed medical professional maintained for the practice of that profession. 
    Mini-storage facility (self-service storage facility) means a structure not exceeding 20 feet in height and containing separate individual and private storage spaces of varying sizes, leased for various periods of time. 
    Mobile home means a movable home on a permanent chassis built to individual state industrialized building codes prior to the enactment in 1976 of the U. S. Housing and Urban Development regulations implementing the National Manufacturing Housing Construction and Safety Standards Act.* 
* As distinguished from "manufactured homes" as defined in the Code of Virginia. 
    Modular home means a manufactured housing unit designed and constructed without a carriage or hitch, as a stationary single-family dwelling constructed for the placement upon a permanent foundation to be connected with utilities and usually consisting of two or more components separately transported but assembled on a site as one integral dwelling unit. 
    Monopole billboard sign (see billboard). Monopole billboard signs shall be constructed on a single pole. 
    Nonconforming lot means an otherwise legally platted lot that does not conform to the minimum area or width requirements of the zoning district in which it is located either at the effective date of the zoning ordinance or as a result of subsequent amendments thereto. 
    Nonconforming structure means an otherwise legal building or structure that does not conform with the lot area, yard, height, lot coverage, or other area regulations of the zoning district in which it is located, or its intended use does not conform to the use regulations of the zoning district in which it is located, either at the effective date of the zoning ordinance or as a result of subsequent amendments thereto. 
    Nonconforming use or activity means the otherwise legal use of a building or structure or of the tract of land that does not conform to the use regulations of the zoning district in which it is located, either at the effective date of the zoning ordinance or as a result of subsequent amendments thereto. 
    Off-street parking area means space for the temporary parking or storage of motor vehicles not within the right-of-way of a dedicated street, but with access thereto, and including aisles or other space necessary for ingress and egress to such parking spaces. 
    Off-street parking space means an area having dimensions of not less than nine feet wide nor 18 feet deep in addition to space required for ingress and egress from a public street. 
    Person means any individual, firm, partnership, copartnership, corporation, company, association or joint stock association, including any trustee, receiver, assignee or personal representative thereof carrying on or continuing a business, profession, trade or occupation (signs). 
    Plan of development means a general master plan for an area of contiguous size and under single ownership showing how the area is proposed to be developed and used for a business, industry or dwellings. 
    Plat means a map or plan of a tract or parcel of land which is to be or which has been subdivided. The word "plat" includes the terms map, plan, plot, replat, or replot. When used as a verb, "plat" is synonymous with "subdivide." 
    Principal use means the primary or main use of a lot. 
    Production agriculture means the production or harvesting of agricultural products but not the processing of agricultural products or above ground application or storage of sewage sludge. Agricultural operation means any operation devoted to the production of crops, animals or fowl which is not an adjunct to and minor part of normal farming activities.* 
* This definition and the regulation to which it relates in Article III are taken in part from the Code of Virginia provisions dealing with "production agriculture" and "agricultural operation." Refer to Code of Virginia, §§ 3.1-22.28 and 3.1-22.29 for more details. The full regulations of that section do not apply to towns since the regulations are part of the "Right to Farm" act applicable only to counties. 
    Professional or business office means offices for the provision of professional or business services where no product is sold. Firms offering professional or business services may include medical doctors, dentists, attorneys, optometrists, chiropractors, anesthetists, certified public accountants, licensed insurance agents, licensed or certified professional engineers, architects, landscape architects and land surveyors. 
    Property means any tract, lot, parcel or several of the same collected together for the purpose of subdividing. 
    Public water and sewerage system means a water or sewer system owned and operated by a municipality or county, or owned and operated by the council and properly licensed by the state corporation commission, and subject to special regulations as set forth in applicable town ordinances. 
    Recreational vehicle means a vehicle built on a chassis and designed to be self-propelled or towable by another vehicle which is not more than 29 feet in length nor less than 320 square feet of horizontal floor area. 
    Required open space means any space required in any front, side, or rear yard. 
    Restaurant means any building in which for compensation food or beverages are dispensed for consumption on or off the premises, including among other establishments, cafes, tea rooms, confectionery shops or refreshment stands. 
    Restaurant, fast-food, means any restaurant whose principal business is the sale of rapidly-prepared food directly to the customer in a ready-to-eat state and which is sold either from a service counter within the building or from a drive-through window. 
    Retail stores and shops means buildings wherein the principal activity is the sale of merchandise at retail to the consumer, and where the merchandise is typically sold in small quantities and broken lots but specifically exclusive of coal, wood, and lumber yards. The following serve to illustrate: drugstore, newsstand, food store, candy shop, milk dispensary, drygoods and notions store, antique store and gift shop, hardware store, household appliance store, furniture store, florist, optician, music and radio store, tailor shop, barbershop, and beauty shop. 
    Right-of-way means a strip of land acquired by reservation, dedication or other legal means and intended to be occupied by a road, crosswalk, railroad, electric transmission line, oil or gas pipeline, sanitary or storm sewer or other similar use. 
    Rooming house. See "boarding house." 
    Setback. See "yard, front." 
    Sheltered workshop means a work place for mentally or developmentally handicapped individuals may engage in work and receive training to enhance their skills to do productive work. 
    Sign means any display of any letters, words, numerals, figures, devices, emblems, pictures, or any parts of combinations thereof, by any means whereby the same are made visible for the purpose of making anything known, whether such display be made on, attached to, or as a part of a structure, surface or any other thing, including but not limited to the ground, any rock, tree, or other natural object, which display is visible beyond the boundaries of the parcel of land on which the same is made. In addition: 
(1)  Animated sign means any sign, the entire structure of which rotates, moves or in any way simulates motion; except for clocks and for the changeable message area of a sign face. 
(2)  Sign area means the area of a sign computed as the area within four straight lines forming a rectangle (a maximum of two abutting or overlapping rectangles may be used) enclosing the extreme limits of writing, representation, pictorial elements, emblems or a figure of similar character, together with all material, color or lighting forming an integral part of the display provided: 
a.  The area of a double-faced sign shall be considered to be the area on one side only. Should one face contain a larger sign area than the other, the larger face shall be used in calculating the sign area. 
b.  The supports, uprights or structure on which any sign is so supported shall not be included in determining the sign area unless such supports, uprights or structure area are designed in such a manner as to form an integral background of the display. 
(3)  Business sign means a sign which directs attention only to a business, commodity, service, activity or product sold, conducted or offered upon the premises where such sign is located. 
(4)  Changeable-message sign means a sign of which not more than 75 percent of its face is designed to support letters, figures or other detachable emblems which alter the information displayed by such sign. 
(5)  Church bulletin/church identification sign means a sign 24 or less square feet in area (double-faced permitted) located on the church property for church activities. 
(6)  Community sign means a sign, located at the principal entrance to an individual residential development, erected or displayed by the residential homeowner's association for the purpose of identifying the name of the residential community and providing information relating to the private nonprofit activities and causes supported solely by the individual home owner's association for the private benefit of the residents only. 
(7)  Educational institution (school) sign means a sign located at the principal entrance to and on the property under the control of a state licensed and approved educational institution. Such sign shall be solely for the purpose of identifying the institution and the non-profit events sponsored by the institution for its student body. 
(8)  Flashing sign means an illuminated sign on which the artificial light is not kept stationary or constant in intensity as all times when in use. Illuminated signs which indicate the time, temperature, date or similar public services information shall be deemed "flashing signs." 
(9)  Freestanding ground sign means a sign supported by upright structural members or by braces on or in the ground and not attached to the building. A ground sign designated as a changeable message sign shall be governed by the provision of article XII of the zoning ordinance relating to changeable message signs. 
(10)  Height of sign means the maximum vertical distance from the uppermost extremity of a sign or its support to the average ground level at the base of the sign. 
(11)  Home occupation sign means a sign not exceeding four square feet in area directing attention to the product, commodity or service available on the premises, but which clearly is a secondary use of the dwelling. 
(12)  Permanent sign means a sign that is intended to last indefinitely and is either attached to a building or a post or one that is secured in the ground and supported by one or more poles. 
(13)  Pole sign means a ground sign that exceeds 25 feet in height and is supported by one or more poles, posts or columns. 
(14)  Projecting sign means a sign which is attached to the building wall and which extends more than 15 inches from the face of such wall. Shingle signs, as defined herein, shall not be deemed "projecting signs." 
(15)  Public sign means any sign erected or displayed in a public right-of-way, or on a property owned by the town, when such sign is created and funded through the authority of the town council for the purpose of informing the general public of specific information relevant to the general health, safety, welfare or morals of the community. 
(16)  Roof sign means a display sign erected on a building roof (but not to include a display painted directly on the roof surface) constructed of materials which are capable of withstanding customary environmental changes without loss of texture or integrity, which displays a message content declaring specific goods or services of a promotional nature that may be found on the same site. 
(17)  Shingle sign means either of the following: (i) a sign containing a maximum aggregate sign area of four square feet, mounted by means of one vertical post, not to exceed eight feet in height and one horizontal member not to exceed three and one-half feet in length from which said sign shall be hung. The message content of said sign shall be no more than six feet above ground level, or (ii) a sign containing a maximum aggregate sign area of two square feet mounted on and perpendicular to a building, the upper extremity of said sign to be no more than ten feet above ground level. 
(18)  Subdivision sign means a sign located at the principal entrance to a group of residential lots constructed as part of a single development project and identifying the single development project by a single name. 
(19)  Temporary directional sign means a temporary sign constructed of cardboard or similar materials mounted on a wooden stake containing only such information as necessary to direct interested persons to a specific location. No advertising figures, such as purchase prices, rates of interest, etc., shall be displayed on a temporary directional sign. 
(20)  Wall sign means a sign which is attached to or painted on the wall of a building, with the face in a plane parallel to such wall, and not extending more than 15 inches from the face of such wall. Business signs painted directly on fences may be considered as wall signs. 
    Site means any tract, lot or parcel of land or combination of tracts, lots, or parcels of land which are in one ownership, or are contiguous and in diverse ownership where development is to be performed as a part of a unit, subdivision, or project. 
    Site plan means a detailed plan for the development of an area of contiguous size and under single ownership showing the proposed detailed development of the property and such other information necessary to demonstrate that the development is in compliance with all applicable regulations. 
    Special exception means a special use, that is a use not permitted in a particular zoning district except by a special use permit granted under the provisions of the zoning ordinance by the town council. 
    Street means the principal means of access to abutting properties. 
    Street or alley, public use of, means the unrestricted use of a specified area or right-of-way for ingress and egress to two or more abutting properties. 
    Street, pavement, width of, means the measured distance from the edge of the pavement to the edge of the pavement or from the face of the curb to the face of the curb. "Pavement" shall mean eight inches of aggregate base, two inches of base course asphalt and one and one-half inches of asphalt surface mix. 
    Street width means the total width of the strip of land dedicated or reserved for public travel, including roadways, curbs, gutters, sidewalks, and planting strips. 
    Subdivider means an individual, corporation or registered partnership, owning any tract, lot or parcel of land to be subdivided, or a group of two or more persons owning any tract, lot or parcel of land to be subdivided, who have given their power of attorney to one of their group or to another individual to act on their behalf in planning, negotiating for, in representing, or executing the legal requirements of the subdivision. The term "subdivider" includes developer. 
    Subdivision means, unless otherwise excepted in a specific ordinance, the division of a parcel of land into two or more lots or parcels for the purpose of transfer of ownership and/or for the creation of individual parcels for building development, provided also that: 
(1)  The term "subdivision" includes resubdivision. 
(2)  The word "subdivide" and any derivative thereof shall have reference to the term "subdivider" as defined in this chapter. 
(3)  Within the extraterritorial jurisdiction beyond the corporate limits of the town, the term "to subdivide" shall not include a bona fide division or partition of agricultural land for agricultural purposes or for the building site for members of the family owning any such agricultural lands. 
There is excepted from the definition of subdivision and the application of this chapter the following, provided however, plats prepared pursuant hereto are reviewed and approved by the zoning administrator: 
(1)  The straightening or rearranging of property lines of adjoining parcels which do not result in any nonconforming lot. 
(2)  Any divisions of land by court order or approval of a court of competent jurisdiction, or between or among heirs in the settlement, partition or allotment of an estate or family partition. 
(3)  A parcel of land being conveyed to an adjoining property owner provided the plat and deed of conveyance contain the following language: 
Notice: The parcel described and conveyed herein is excepted from approval under the Subdivision Ordinance of the Town of South Hill only as an additional parcel being conveyed to an adjoining landowner, and may not be reconveyed except as a whole with the adjoining property or with further approval as required under the Subdivision Ordinance of the Town of South Hill and which does not result in any nonconforming lot. 
    Tattoo salon means any place where tattooing is offered or practiced. This profession shall be regulated by the department of professional and occupational regulations as found in the Code of Virginia, 1950 as amended, in tit. 54.1, ch. 7 and also all sections of the Virginia Administrative Code pertaining to tattoo salons. 
    Telecommunication towers and antennas. The following special definitions apply to regulations and standards for telecommunication antennas and towers. 
(1)  Tower means any structure that is designed and constructed primarily for the purpose of supporting one or more antennas, including self-supporting lattice towers, guy towers, or monopole towers. The term includes radio and television transmission towers, microwave towers, common-carrier towers, cellular telephone towers, alternative tower structures, and the like. 
(2)  Alternative tower structure means man-made trees, clock towers, bell steeples, light poles and similar alternative-design mounting structures that camouflage or conceal the presence of antennas or towers. 
(3)  Antenna means any apparatus designed for telephonic, data, radio, or television communications through the sending and/or receiving of electromagnetic waves. 
(4)  FAA means the Federal Aviation Administration. 
(5)  FCC means the Federal Communications Commission. 
(6)  Height, when referring to a telecommunications tower or other structure, means the distance measured from ground level to the highest point on the tower or other structure, even if the highest point is an antenna or lightning rod. 
    Thrift store means a retail enterprise that sells merchandise acquired by donations or purchased for resale. 
    Tourist court; tourist home. See "hotel/motel." 
    Town means the Town of South Hill, Virginia. 
    Travel trailer. See "recreational vehicle." 
    Townhouse. See "dwelling, townhouse." 
    Truck stop means a service station providing services primarily to the trucking trade, which may include motor fuel, mechanical repair and services, tire service and repair, restaurant, barbershop, telegraphic communication service, and merchandise store for sale of accessory and emergency items. 
    Urban development area (UDA) means areas planned for compact, mix-use and walkable development, following the principles of traditional neighborhood design. 
    Variance means a reasonable deviation from those provisions regulating the size or area of a lot or parcel of land, or the size, area, bulk or location of a building or structure when the strict application of this ordinance would result in unnecessary or reasonable hardship to the property owner, and such need for a variance would not be shared generally by other properties and provided such variance is not contrary to the intended spirit and purpose of the ordinance and would result in substantial justice being done. The term shall not include the change in use which shall otherwise be accomplished only by a rezoning or a conditional use permit.* 
* From the state code, § 15-2.2201. 
    Virginia Code or state code means the Code of Virginia, 1950, as amended. 
    Wayside stand, roadside stand, wayside market means any structure or land used for the sale of agricultural or horticultural produce, livestock, or merchandise produced by the owner or his family on their farm. 
    Yard means an open space on a lot other than a court unoccupied and unobstructed from the ground upward, except as otherwise provided herein. 
    Yard, front, means an open space on the same lot as a building between the front line of the building (excluding steps) and the front lot or street line, and extending across the full width of the lot. 
    Yard, rear, means an open, unoccupied space on the same lot as the building between the rear line of the building (excluding steps) and the rear line of the lot and extending the full width of the lot. 
    Yard, side, means an open, unoccupied space on the same lot as a building between the side line of the building (excluding steps) and the side line of the lot, and extending from the front yard line to the rear yard line. 
    Zoning administrator means the official charged with the enforcement of the zoning ordinance. 
(Ord. of 12-11-00; Ord. of 12-18-01; Ord. of 6-9-03(2); Ord. of 10-14-03; Ord. of 9-12-05(2); Ord. of 1-9-06; Ord. of 4-10-06; Ord. of 5-8-06(2); Ord. of 8-14-06; Ord. of 4-12-10; Ord. No. 2010-11, 11-8-10; Ord. No. 2011-1, 5-9-11; Ord. No. 2012-5, 4-9-12; Ord. No. 2018-4, 4-9-18)
